title: 115_hr3715
content: The Act titled "Scenic Columbia Gorge Restoration Act of 2017" allows for expedited recovery activities in response to catastrophic events in national scenic areas. The Act defines a catastrophic event as any natural disaster or fire, flood, or explosion, and includes containment of the event before its actual end. The Act defines a catastrophic event as any natural disaster or fire, flood, or explosion, and includes containment of the event before its actual end. A National Scenic Area is an area of the National Forest System designated for its natural, scenic, and recreational values. Response activity refers to salvage or reforestation efforts in a National Scenic Area impacted by a catastrophic event. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the relevant department. The Secretary of Agriculture, through the Chief of the Forest Service, must propose response activities within 30 days of a catastrophic event in a National Scenic Area. Public input and objection periods are set at 30 days and 15 days respectively for the response activities. The Secretary of Agriculture must propose response activities within 30 days of a catastrophic event in a National Scenic Area. An expedited environmental assessment for the response activity should be completed within 60 days, with 30 days for public input and 15 days for filing objections. The Secretary shall implement the response activity after this process. Response activities in National Scenic Areas must be proposed within 30 days of a catastrophic event and completed within 60 days. A categorical exclusion is available for response activities not exceeding 10,000 acres and including visible lands from key viewing areas. Response activities in National Scenic Areas must be proposed within 30 days of a catastrophic event and completed within 60 days. A categorical exclusion is available for activities not exceeding 10,000 acres and including visible lands from key viewing areas. Consultation under the Endangered Species Act is not required if the Secretary determines that a response activity is not likely to adversely affect a listed species or designated critical habitat. The Secretary may determine that a response activity will not harm listed species or critical habitat. Expedited consultation under the Endangered Species Act must be completed within 90 days if not covered by the previous provision. Effect of no conclusion: If a consultation under the Endangered Species Act is not concluded within 90 days, the response activity may proceed without violating the Act. No restraining orders or injunctions can be issued during this time. Injunctions Pending Appeal.--No court in the United States can issue restraining orders or injunctions pending appeal for response activities. Funding from the Knutson-Vandenberg Act can be used for these activities on National Scenic Area lands. The Secretary must reforest at least 75% of National Scenic Area lands impacted by a catastrophic event within two years of the event.
